page.title: 09WOOLHOPE FARMING
page.content: {Horticulture There are some areas of cider orchards. The apples are sent to Bulmers in Hereford, Westons in Much Marcle & Symonds in Stoke Lacey. Bees are kept to help pollinate the blossom in spring. Strawberries & raspberries are grown commercially on the sunny slopes, also some blackcurrants. This offers some seasonal employment. There are two small areas of hops. One farm still has an oast house for drying them. Nowadays all picking is done mechanically. Cabbages are also grown commercially.
